title: Understanding Absolute References
text: Absolute references in spreadsheets use the dollar sign ($) to lock the column and/or row. This ensures that when a formula is copied to another cell, the reference remains constant.

hintAnswer: Alex should use absolute references by changing the formula to =$A$1*$B$1
title: Choosing the Correct Reference Type
text: What type of reference should Alex use to ensure the formula remains unchanged when copied?
choices: Alex should use absolute references by changing the formula to =$A$1*$B$1
Alex should use relative references by changing the formula to $$=A1 B1$$
Alex should use mixed references by changing the formula to =$A1*B$1
Alex should use a named range for the formula
